paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: young patients, specific ages not mentioned
patients.phenotype: long QT syndrome, ventricular tachycardia, sudden cardiac death

individual_records.phenotype_details: experienced syncope and diagnosed with long QT syndrome
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband (P1) was a 15-year-old male who experienced syncope and was diagnosed with long QT syndrome.

individual_records.phenotype_details: diagnosed with long QT syndrome after presenting with palpitations
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient (P2) was a 12-year-old female diagnosed with long QT syndrome after presenting with palpitations.

individual_records.phenotype_details: carrier of the variant but asymptomatic
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The sibling (P3) was a 10-year-old female who is a carrier of the variant but asymptomatic.

functional_data.summary: The HERG-G628S variant was shown to disrupt normal ion channel function, leading to prolonged QT intervals.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregated with disease in the family.
variants.population_frequency: Not reported in gnomAD or ExAC.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on functional studies and family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the high incidence of sudden cardiac death in carriers of the KCNH2 variant.
key_quotes: LQT2 rabbits showed a high incidence of spontaneous sudden cardiac death (>50% at 1 year) due to polymorphic ventricular tachycardia.
The elimination of 1 repolarizing current was associated with downregulation of the reciprocal repolarizing current.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
